page.title: 18FAMILY FARM IN SPETISBURY
page.content: We have three children and farm 53O acres of varied farm land, three small woods,fields of grass and arable land. Two dairies exist as separate entities milking approximately 1OO Freisian pedigree cows in each.We also have approximately 18O acres of corn,which is largely barley and wheat,but a few acres of oats are grown and kale for cows and pheasants.We grow a few Christmas trees as a cash crop,but they take seven years from sapling to cropping.The whole family helps on the farm,which also employs five fulltime staff:two dairymen and three tractor drivers.The farm has been in existence since the 13th Century,when it was farmed by nuns.Long may we keep the farm a family concern,that is until the government makes it financially impossible to stay viable.
